haiku:
Force steers silent mass
Across space it bends each path
Vector in my hand

Momentum persists
When engines fade, it stays still
Mass times speed, unspent

Acceleration
Turns rest to swift motion now
Seconds shape the curve

Pure velocity
Direction tied to pace now
Arrow through cold air

Position marks here
A dot on graphs of time just
Origin waits still

Gravity draws down
Planets lean into its pull
Falling feels like home

Inertia clings
To carts that hate to stop hard
Stillness loves its throne

A rigid body
Spins without bending its form
Angles stay in lock

Moment arms extend
Torque rises from offset force
Levers sing in steel

Rotation in night
Stars wheel round a quiet pole
Centrifuge of awe

Lagrangian guides
Least action chooses the path
Nature writes in sums

Hamiltonian
Counts energy in phase space
Time steps, equations

Motion sketches arcs
Through air, vacuum, and rain
Worldlines on my mind

Conservation holds
In equals out, in the end
Cosmic ledger stays

A constant remains
Variables drift away
Anchor in the math

Friction eats speed up
Heat blooms where rough planes meet hard
Sparks fade into rest

Oscillator sings
Back and forth on cosine waves
Balance, then return

Spring stores hidden work
Stretch it; it longs for zero
Hooke hums softly now

Pendulum keeps time
Swinging under steady g
Arc to arc, it breathes

Rocket climbs on fire
Mass falls away; thrust rises
Sky thins into black

Choose a frame of view
Then laws look simple, or twist
Axes can agree

Non-inertial turns
Phantom forces bloom in spin
Coriolis laughs

Time flows ever on
Clocks trade ticks for aging light
Now becomes then soon

Orbit holds the moon
Free fall curled into circles
Ellipses keep vows

Energy shifts shape
From heat to light, to stone raised
Nothing lost, just moved

A force pulls us on
Mass resists, yet still we surge
Path bends, then goes straight

Hold momentum still
No push, and it keeps its way
Collide; speeds swap now

Acceleration
Turns calm drift into sharp change
Speed climbs each heartbeat

Sign tells which way now

Mark position here

Gravity calls down

Inertia holds

Spin keeps its rhythm
